item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Igor Sikorsky
item.description: "Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle." -- Igor Sikorsky

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "I fly because it releases my mind from the tyranny of petty things. " -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Wilbur Wright
item.description: "More than anything else, the sensation [of flying] is one of perfect peace mingled with an excitement that strains every nerve to the utmost - if you can conceive of such a combination." -- Wilbur Wright

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by John Derbyshire
item.description: "Books, in the plural lose their solidity of substance and become a gas, filling all available space." -- John Derbyshire

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Kobi Yamada
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to take the leap and build your wings on the way down." -- Kobi Yamada

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Kobi Yamada
item.description: "Intense desire not only creates its own possibilities, but its own talents. Don't be afraid to do something just because it's impossible." -- Kobi Yamada

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Ed Hahn
item.description: "Whatever "expertise" I pretend to have is actually made up of conscious experience, overwhelming curiosity, discerning observation and friends whose opinions I trust. " -- Ed Hahn

item.title: Kayleen add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein
